Its not as bad as you think.
I will tell you that, yes it does have gore. The trailers do show a lot of it. But in the actual gameplay it defenitly does not have that much compared to it. The blood doesnt show up like over every thing like in most gore games. The most gore thing is that the killer puts you on a hook like in texas chainsaw massacure. If your kid can handle that. They should be fine.
The community you would think would be toxic(meaning to the in game text chat at the end of rounds) they acually really good people. I have been playing this game for a little bit and probaly one person out of all of them was rude to me. Every one else just said good game or just very nicely talking to each other.
I dont think this game is for really young kids like 9 and 10 but if they can watch horror movies and they know right from wrong I say that they should be able to handle this game.

Pros
- Fun with friends
- Variety
- Supportive Devs
- Challenges

Cons
- MM is broken. 
- Toxic community
- Game is somewhat broken. No hope of it getting fixed.

The game was great for a the few years that it was out, but the new update ruined what DBD was all about. The long nights after coming home to enjoy a fun game aren't an option anymore. I had put 1000 hours on console and PC and would have 0 complaints, but with it's new "skill based matchmaking" I can't ignore how the fun of a once well polished game has been destroyed. If you plan to become the next DBD pro then its a good buy, but if you work 50 plus hours a week like me and want to come home to a fun game to play with friends then I would suggest avoiding this game.

If you buy this game be prepared to wait for 30 mins for a match and for the game to end in under 20 mins with the survivors always being twice your rank or red ranks and prepared to get railed and get sweat on by the 4 stack who all brought purple flashlights decisive  strike, dead hard, and flashbang with borrowed time of course and be prepared to get shit talked in the after lobby as they call you shit as they were all in a discord call comunicating with 1-5k hours while you just got the game and have no perks. Other than all that, the ping, and the active ddosing, and buggy dlc releases, and horrible hitboxes i totally recommend that you get this game

Reviewing after 2500 hours across 2 accounts because I'm disappointed in the direction BHVR has taken. I play this game at the end of the day after work and the implementation of Skill-Based Matchmaking has made it so I cannot do that at any hour without being thrown into a stressful match.

I appreciate that Behavior is actively adjusting the game in order to make it more fun, but the MMR system is actively harmful to the health of the game. MMR incentivizes always bringing the most broken, meta perks and items in order to win, and decentivizes fun builds and personal preference for both the survivor AND killer. It seems that Behavior decided that if survivors win every game then 80% of the players in every game (the 4 survivors) would have fun. MMR made an already survivor sided game even more survivor sided.

It has its moments. But like those bad horror movies that aren't fun when they're bad, it can get just bad. It's like the one horror movie you would watch again but would have to let a lot of time go by before you rewatch it. Replay value is very little. Collecting all the free blood points has been fun, though.
Would recommend only for the free blood points from the developer's faults.

Great video game to play at all times of the day and of the night. This is the game that we all try to aspire to be in real life.

While the game is fun and thrilling, some of the killers desperately need a nerf. the fact the doctor can find you by spamming his ability without issues is just blatantly stupid and should not be a thing. the survivors need a chance to, well, survive. on so many occasions i find myself getting pissed off because some guy was abusing the most broken killer in the game, and the newest addition to the killer roster is no different. he forces you to find this little box on the opposite side of the map and if he so wishes, he can teleport to you while you are using it. the box breaks you out of this chain effect where chains appear out of nowhere and grab onto you, slowing you down and stopping you from sprinting. and its constantly hunting you if you dont get the box in time. its absolutely broken and god damn it, it needs a nerf yesterday
